data.value: So when he had furnished them with their supplies, he put the [gold measuring] bowl into the bag of his brother. Then an announcer called out, "O caravan, indeed you are thieves."

data.name: Quran1667
data.value: They said while approaching them, "What is it you are missing?"

data.name: Quran1668
data.value: They said, "We are missing the measure of the king. And for he who produces it is [the reward of] a camel's load, and I am responsible for it."

data.name: Quran1669
data.value: They said, "By Allah, you have certainly known that we did not come to cause corruption in the land, and we have not been thieves."

data.name: Quran1670
data.value: The accusers said, "Then what would be its recompense if you should be liars?"

data.name: Quran1671
data.value: [The brothers] said, "Its recompense is that he in whose bag it is found - he [himself] will be its recompense. Thus do we recompense the wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran1672
data.value: So he began [the search] with their bags before the bag of his brother; then he extracted it from the bag of his brother. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother within the religion of the king except that Allah willed. We raise in degrees whom We will, but over every possessor of knowledge is one [more] knowing.

data.name: Quran1673
data.value: They said, "If he steals - a brother of his has stolen before." But Joseph kept it within himself and did not reveal it to them. He said, "You are worse in position, and Allah is most knowing of what you describe."

data.name: Quran1674
data.value: They said, "O 'Azeez, indeed he has a father [who is] an old man, so take one of us in place of him. Indeed, we see you as a doer of good."

data.name: Quran1675
data.value: He said, "[I seek] the refuge of Allah [to prevent] that we take except him with whom we found our possession. Indeed, we would then be unjust."

data.name: Quran1676
data.value: So when they had despaired of him, they secluded themselves in private consultation. The eldest of them said, "Do you not know that your father has taken upon you an oath by Allah and [that] before you failed in [your duty to] Joseph? So I will never leave [this] land until my father permits me or Allah decides for me, and He is the best of judges.

data.name: Quran1677
data.value: Return to your father and say, "O our father, indeed your son has stolen, and we did not testify except to what we knew. And we were not witnesses of the unseen,

data.name: Quran1678
data.value: And ask the city in which we were and the caravan in which we came - and indeed, we are truthful,"

data.name: Quran1679
data.value: [Jacob] said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. Perhaps Allah will bring them to me all together. Indeed it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise."

data.name: Quran1680
data.value: And he turned away from them and said, "Oh, my sorrow over Joseph," and his eyes became white from grief, for he was [of that] a suppressor.

data.name: Quran1681
data.value: They said, "By Allah, you will not cease remembering Joseph until you become fatally ill or become of those who perish."

data.name: Quran1682
data.value: He said, "I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know.

data.name: Quran1683
data.value: O my sons, go and find out about Joseph and his brother and despair not of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people."

data.name: Quran1684
data.value: So when they entered upon Joseph, they said, "O 'Azeez, adversity has touched us and our family, and we have come with goods poor in quality, but give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."

data.name: Quran1685
data.value: He said, "Do you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant?"

data.name: Quran1686
data.value: They said, "Are you indeed Joseph?" He said "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Allah has certainly favored us. Indeed, he who fears Allah and is patient, then indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good."

data.name: Quran1687
data.value: They said, "By Allah, certainly has Allah preferred you over us, and indeed, we have been sinners."

data.name: Quran1688
data.value: He said, "No blame will there be upon you today. Allah will forgive you; and He is the most merciful of the merciful."

data.name: Quran1689
data.value: Take this, my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father; he will become seeing. And bring me your family, all together."

data.name: Quran1690
data.value: And when the caravan departed [from Egypt], their father said, "Indeed, I find the smell of Joseph [and would say that he was alive] if you did not think me weakened in mind."

data.name: Quran1691
data.value: They said, "By Allah, indeed you are in your [same] old error."

data.name: Quran1692
data.value: And when the bearer of good tidings arrived, he cast it over his face, and he returned [once again] seeing. He said, "Did I not tell you that I know from Allah that which you do not know?"

data.name: Quran1693
data.value: They said, "O our father, ask for us forgiveness of our sins; indeed, we have been sinners."

data.name: Quran1694
data.value: He said, "I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

data.name: Quran1695
data.value: And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his parents to himself and said, "Enter Egypt, Allah willing, safe [and secure]."

data.name: Quran1696
data.value: And he raised his parents upon the throne, and they bowed to him in prostration. And he said, "O my father, this is the explanation of my vision of before. My Lord has made it reality. And He was certainly good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you [here] from bedouin life after Satan had induced [estrangement] between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle in what He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise.

data.name: Quran1697
data.value: My Lord, You have given me [something] of sovereignty and taught me of the interpretation of dreams. Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous."

data.name: Quran1698
data.value: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal, [O Muhammad], to you. And you were not with them when they put together their plan while they conspired.

data.name: Quran1699
data.value: And most of the people, although you strive [for it], are not believers.

data.name: Quran1700
data.value: And you do not ask of them for it any payment. It is not except a reminder to the worlds.

data.name: Quran1701
data.value: And how many a sign within the heavens and earth do they pass over while they, therefrom, are turning away.

data.name: Quran1702
data.value: And most of them believe not in Allah except while they associate others with Him.

data.name: Quran1703
data.value: Then do they feel secure that there will not come to them an overwhelming [aspect] of the punishment of Allah or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?

data.name: Quran1704
data.value: Say, "This is my way; I invite to Allah with insight, I and those who follow me. And exalted is Allah; and I am not of those who associate others with Him."

data.name: Quran1705
data.value: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah; then will you not reason?

data.name: Quran1706
data.value: [They continued] until, when the messengers despaired and were certain that they had been denied, there came to them Our victory, and whoever We willed was saved. And Our punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals.

data.name: Quran1707
data.value: There was certainly in their stories a lesson for those of understanding. Never was the Qur'an a narration invented, but a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of all things and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

data.name: Quran1708
data.value: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the verses of the Book; and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.

data.name: Quran1709
data.value: It is Allah who erected the heavens without pillars that you [can] see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. He arranges [each] matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.

data.name: Quran1710
data.value: And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

data.name: Quran1711
data.value: And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, [growing] several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

data.name: Quran1712
data.value: And if you are astonished, [O Muhammad] - then astonishing is their saying, "When we are dust, will we indeed be [brought] into a new creation?" Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord, and those will have shackles upon their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

data.name: Quran1713
data.value: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand]. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.

data.name: Quran1714
data.value: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.

data.name: Quran1715
data.value: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure.

data.name: Quran1716
data.value: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted.

data.name: Quran1717
data.value: It is the same [to Him] concerning you whether one conceals [his] speech or one publicizes it and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous [among others] by day.

data.name: Quran1718
data.value: For each one are successive [angels] before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.

data.name: Quran1719
data.value: It is He who shows you lightening, [causing] fear and aspiration, and generates the heavy clouds.

data.name: Quran1720
data.value: And the thunder exalts [Allah] with praise of Him - and the angels [as well] from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allah; and He is severe in assault.

data.name: Quran1721
data.value: To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it [thus]. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e. futility].

data.name: Quran1722
data.value: And to Allah prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.

data.name: Quran1723
data.value: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?" Say, "Allah." Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies not possessing [even] for themselves any benefit or any harm?" Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Or is darkness equivalent to light? Or have they attributed to Allah partners who created like His creation so that the creation [of each] seemed similar to them?" Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing."

data.name: Quran1724
data.value: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allah presents [the example of] truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples.

data.name: Quran1725
data.value: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward], but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.

data.name: Quran1726
data.value: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -

data.name: Quran1727
data.value: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract,

data.name: Quran1728
data.value: And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,

data.name: Quran1729
data.value: And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -

data.name: Quran1730
data.value: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],

data.name: Quran1731
data.value: "Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home."

data.name: Quran1732
data.value: But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.

data.name: Quran1733
data.value: Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.

data.name: Quran1734
data.value: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -

data.name: Quran1735
data.value: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured."

data.name: Quran1736
data.value: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.

data.name: Quran1737
data.value: Thus have We sent you to a community before which [other] communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return."

data.name: Quran1738
data.value: And if there was any qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur'an], but to Allah belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in [His] promise.

data.name: Quran1739
data.value: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

data.name: Quran1740
data.value: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, [knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]? But to Allah they have attributed partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent of speech?" Rather, their [own] plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allah leaves astray - there will be for him no guide.

data.name: Quran1741
data.value: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector.

data.name: Quran1742
data.value: The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.

data.name: Quran1743
data.value: And [the believers among] those to whom We have given the [previous] Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not associate [anything] with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."

data.name: Quran1744
data.value: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector.

data.name: Quran1745
data.value: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.

data.name: Quran1746
data.value: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.

data.name: Quran1747
data.value: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.

data.name: Quran1748
data.value: Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.

data.name: Quran1749
data.value: And those before them had plotted, but to Allah belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.

data.name: Quran1750
data.value: And those who have disbelieved say, "You are not a messenger." Say, [O Muhammad], "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you, and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."

data.name: Quran1751
data.value: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -

data.name: Quran1752
data.value: Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment

data.name: Quran1753
data.value: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah, seeking to make it (seem) deviant. Those are in extreme error.

data.name: Quran1754
data.value: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

data.name: Quran1755
data.value: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

data.name: Quran1756
data.value: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when Moses said to His people, "Remember the favor of Allah upon you when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

data.name: Quran1757
data.value: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.' "

data.name: Quran1758
data.value: And Moses said, "If you should disbelieve, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."

data.name: Quran1759
data.value: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

data.name: Quran1760
data.value: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."

data.name: Quran1761
data.value: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

data.name: Quran1762
data.value: And why should we not rely upon Allah while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allah let those who would rely [indeed] rely."

data.name: Quran1763
data.value: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.

data.name: Quran1764
data.value: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."

data.name: Quran1765
data.value: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.

data.name: Quran1766
data.value: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.

data.name: Quran1767
data.value: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.

data.name: Quran1768
data.value: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.

data.name: Quran1769
data.value: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.

data.name: Quran1770
data.value: And that is not difficult for Allah.

data.name: Quran1771
data.value: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."

data.name: Quran1772
data.value: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allah] before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."

data.name: Quran1773
data.value: And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"

data.name: Quran1774
data.value: Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?

data.name: Quran1775
data.value: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.

data.name: Quran1776
data.value: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.

data.name: Quran1777
data.value: Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.

data.name: Quran1778
data.value: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?

data.name: Quran1779
data.value: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.

data.name: Quran1780
data.value: And they have attributed to Allah equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."

data.name: Quran1781
data.value: [O Muhammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange, nor any friendships.

data.name: Quran1782
data.value: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.

data.name: Quran1783
data.value: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.

data.name: Quran1784
data.value: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.

data.name: Quran1785
data.value: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

data.name: Quran1786
data.value: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.

data.name: Quran1787
data.value: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.

data.name: Quran1788
data.value: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.

data.name: Quran1789
data.value: Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

data.name: Quran1790
data.value: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

data.name: Quran1791
data.value: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."

data.name: Quran1792
data.value: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].

data.name: Quran1793
data.value: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.

data.name: Quran1794
data.value: And, [O Muhammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?

data.name: Quran1795
data.value: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."

data.name: Quran1796
data.value: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.

data.name: Quran1797
data.value: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

data.name: Quran1798
data.value: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

data.name: Quran1799
data.value: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,

data.name: Quran1800
data.value: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.

data.name: Quran1801
data.value: So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.

data.name: Quran1802
data.value: This [Qur'an] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.

data.name: Quran1803
data.value: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

data.name: Quran1804
data.value: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

data.name: Quran1805
data.value: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

data.name: Quran1806
data.value: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

data.name: Quran1807
data.value: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

data.name: Quran1808
data.value: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.

data.name: Quran1809
data.value: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"

data.name: Quran1810
data.value: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

data.name: Quran1811
data.value: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

data.name: Quran1812
data.value: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

data.name: Quran1813
data.value: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

data.name: Quran1814
data.value: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

data.name: Quran1815
data.value: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

data.name: Quran1816
data.value: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

data.name: Quran1817
data.value: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

data.name: Quran1818
data.value: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

data.name: Quran1819
data.value: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]

data.name: Quran1820
data.value: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

data.name: Quran1821
data.value: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

data.name: Quran1822
data.value: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

data.name: Quran1823
data.value: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.

data.name: Quran1824
data.value: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.

data.name: Quran1825
data.value: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.

data.name: Quran1826
data.value: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].

data.name: Quran1827
data.value: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

data.name: Quran1828
data.value: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

data.name: Quran1829
data.value: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

data.name: Quran1830
data.value: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.

data.name: Quran1831
data.value: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

data.name: Quran1832
data.value: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

data.name: Quran1833
data.value: Except Iblees, he refused to be with those who prostrated.

data.name: Quran1834
data.value: [Allah] said, O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"

data.name: Quran1835
data.value: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."

data.name: Quran1836
data.value: [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.

data.name: Quran1837
data.value: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."

data.name: Quran1838
data.value: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

data.name: Quran1839
data.value: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

data.name: Quran1840
data.value: Until the Day of the time well-known."

data.name: Quran1841
data.value: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all

data.name: Quran1842
data.value: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

data.name: Quran1843
data.value: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

data.name: Quran1844
data.value: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

data.name: Quran1845
data.value: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

data.name: Quran1846
data.value: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."

data.name: Quran1847
data.value: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

data.name: Quran1848
data.value: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

data.name: Quran1849
data.value: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

data.name: Quran1850
data.value: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

data.name: Quran1851
data.value: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

data.name: Quran1852
data.value: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

data.name: Quran1853
data.value: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

data.name: Quran1854
data.value: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

data.name: Quran1855
data.value: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

data.name: Quran1856
data.value: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

data.name: Quran1857
data.value: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

data.name: Quran1858
data.value: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

data.name: Quran1859
data.value: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

data.name: Quran1860
data.value: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

data.name: Quran1861
data.value: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

data.name: Quran1862
data.value: Except his wife." Allah decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

data.name: Quran1863
data.value: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

data.name: Quran1864
data.value: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."

data.name: Quran1865
data.value: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,

data.name: Quran1866
data.value: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.

data.name: Quran1867
data.value: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."

data.name: Quran1868
data.value: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

data.name: Quran1869
data.value: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

data.name: Quran1870
data.value: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.

data.name: Quran1871
data.value: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."

data.name: Quran1872
data.value: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"

data.name: Quran1873
data.value: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."

data.name: Quran1874
data.value: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

data.name: Quran1875
data.value: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

data.name: Quran1876
data.value: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

data.name: Quran1877
data.value: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

data.name: Quran1878
data.value: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.

data.name: Quran1879
data.value: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

data.name: Quran1880
data.value: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

data.name: Quran1881
data.value: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

data.name: Quran1882
data.value: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

data.name: Quran1883
data.value: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

data.name: Quran1884
data.value: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

data.name: Quran1885
data.value: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

data.name: Quran1886
data.value: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

data.name: Quran1887
data.value: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

data.name: Quran1888
data.value: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

data.name: Quran1889
data.value: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

data.name: Quran1890
data.value: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers

data.name: Quran1891
data.value: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

data.name: Quran1892
data.value: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

data.name: Quran1893
data.value: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

data.name: Quran1894
data.value: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

data.name: Quran1895
data.value: About what they used to do.

data.name: Quran1896
data.value: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

data.name: Quran1897
data.value: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

data.name: Quran1898
data.value: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.

data.name: Quran1899
data.value: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

data.name: Quran1900
data.value: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

data.name: Quran1901
data.value: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).

data.name: Quran1902
data.value: The command of Allah is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

data.name: Quran1903
data.value: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."

data.name: Quran1904
data.value: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.

data.name: Quran1905
data.value: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.

data.name: Quran1906
data.value: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.

data.name: Quran1907
data.value: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].

data.name: Quran1908
data.value: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

data.name: Quran1909
data.value: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.

data.name: Quran1910
data.value: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among the various paths are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

data.name: Quran1911
data.value: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].

data.name: Quran1912
data.value: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

data.name: Quran1913
data.value: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

data.name: Quran1914
data.value: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

data.name: Quran1915
data.value: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

data.name: Quran1916
data.value: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,

data.name: Quran1917
data.value: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.

data.name: Quran1918
data.value: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?

data.name: Quran1919
data.value: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

data.name: Quran1920
data.value: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.

data.name: Quran1921
data.value: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.

data.name: Quran1922
data.value: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

data.name: Quran1923
data.value: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.

data.name: Quran1924
data.value: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

data.name: Quran1925
data.value: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the former peoples,"

data.name: Quran1926
data.value: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

data.name: Quran1927
data.value: Those before them had already plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

data.name: Quran1928
data.value: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

data.name: Quran1929
data.value: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do.

data.name: Quran1930
data.value: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

data.name: Quran1931
data.value: And it will be said to those who feared Allah, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -

data.name: Quran1932
data.value: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous -

data.name: Quran1933
data.value: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

data.name: Quran1934
data.value: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.

data.name: Quran1935
data.value: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

data.name: Quran1936
data.value: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

data.name: Quran1937
data.value: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid Taghut." And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.

data.name: Quran1938
data.value: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muhammad], indeed, Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.

data.name: Quran1939
data.value: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.

data.name: Quran1940
data.value: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.

data.name: Quran1941
data.value: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

data.name: Quran1942
data.value: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.

data.name: Quran1943
data.value: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.

data.name: Quran1944
data.value: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.

data.name: Quran1945
data.value: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.

data.name: Quran1946
data.value: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?

data.name: Quran1947
data.value: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure?

data.name: Quran1948
data.value: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

data.name: Quran1949
data.value: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah, while they are humble.

data.name: Quran1950
data.value: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.

data.name: Quran1951
data.value: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

data.name: Quran1952
data.value: And Allah has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me."

data.name: Quran1953
data.value: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?

data.name: Quran1954
data.value: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.

data.name: Quran1955
data.value: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

data.name: Quran1956
data.value: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

data.name: Quran1957
data.value: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.

data.name: Quran1958
data.value: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.

data.name: Quran1959
data.value: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

data.name: Quran1960
data.value: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

data.name: Quran1961
data.value: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

data.name: Quran1962
data.value: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

data.name: Quran1963
data.value: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.

data.name: Quran1964
data.value: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

data.name: Quran1965
data.value: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

data.name: Quran1966
data.value: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

data.name: Quran1967
data.value: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

data.name: Quran1968
data.value: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

data.name: Quran1969
data.value: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.

data.name: Quran1970
data.value: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

data.name: Quran1971
data.value: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.

data.name: Quran1972
data.value: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?

data.name: Quran1973
data.value: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

data.name: Quran1974
data.value: And they worship besides Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.

data.name: Quran1975
data.value: So do not assert similarities to Allah. Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.

data.name: Quran1976
data.value: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.

data.name: Quran1977
data.value: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?

data.name: Quran1978
data.value: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

data.name: Quran1979
data.value: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.

data.name: Quran1980
data.value: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

data.name: Quran1981
data.value: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.

data.name: Quran1982
data.value: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

data.name: Quran1983
data.value: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.

data.name: Quran1984
data.value: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.

data.name: Quran1985
data.value: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

data.name: Quran1986
data.value: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

data.name: Quran1987
data.value: And when those who associated others with Allah see their "partners," they will say," Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."

data.name: Quran1988
data.value: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

data.name: Quran1989
data.value: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.

data.name: Quran1990
data.value: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

data.name: Quran1991
data.value: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

data.name: Quran1992
data.value: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.

data.name: Quran1993
data.value: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.

data.name: Quran1994
data.value: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

data.name: Quran1995
data.value: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allah, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

data.name: Quran1996
data.value: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.

data.name: Quran1997
data.value: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

data.name: Quran1998
data.value: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

data.name: Quran1999
data.value: So when you recite the Qur'an, [first] seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

data.name: Quran2000
data.value: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.

data.name: Quran2001
data.value: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah.

data.name: Quran2002
data.value: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.

data.name: Quran2003
data.value: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

data.name: Quran2004
data.value: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.

data.name: Quran2005
data.value: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.

data.name: Quran2006
data.value: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah, and it is those who are the liars.

data.name: Quran2007
data.value: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment;

data.name: Quran2008
data.value: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

data.name: Quran2009
data.value: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.

data.name: Quran2010
data.value: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.

data.name: Quran2011
data.value: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to renounce their religion] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

data.name: Quran2012
data.value: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

data.name: Quran2013
data.value: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

data.name: Quran2014
data.value: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

data.name: Quran2015
data.value: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

data.name: Quran2016
data.value: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

data.name: Quran2017
data.value: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.

data.name: Quran2018
data.value: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.

data.name: Quran2019
data.value: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

data.name: Quran2020
data.value: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

data.name: Quran2021
data.value: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.

data.name: Quran2022
data.value: [He was] grateful for His favors. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.

data.name: Quran2023
data.value: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

data.name: Quran2024
data.value: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.

data.name: Quran2025
data.value: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

data.name: Quran2026
data.value: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

data.name: Quran2027
data.value: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.

data.name: Quran2028
data.value: And be patient, [O Muhammad], and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

data.name: Quran2029
data.value: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

data.name: Quran2030
data.value: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

data.name: Quran2031
data.value: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

data.name: Quran2032
data.value: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

data.name: Quran2033
data.value: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.

data.name: Quran2034
data.value: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.

data.name: Quran2035
data.value: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower

data.name: Quran2036
data.value: [And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves." Then when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the temple in Jerusalem, as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.

data.name: Quran2037
data.value: [Then Allah said], "It is expected, [if you repent], that your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."

data.name: Quran2038
data.value: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.

data.name: Quran2039
data.value: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

data.name: Quran2040
data.value: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.

data.name: Quran2041
data.value: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.

data.name: Quran2042
data.value: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.

data.name: Quran2043
data.value: [It will be said], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."

data.name: Quran2044
data.value: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

data.name: Quran2045
data.value: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

data.name: Quran2046
data.value: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

data.name: Quran2047
data.value: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

data.name: Quran2048
data.value: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah].

data.name: Quran2049
data.value: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

data.name: Quran2050
data.value: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

data.name: Quran2051
data.value: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

data.name: Quran2052
data.value: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.

data.name: Quran2053
data.value: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."

data.name: Quran2054
data.value: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.

data.name: Quran2055
data.value: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

data.name: Quran2056
data.value: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

data.name: Quran2057
data.value: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.

data.name: Quran2058
data.value: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

data.name: Quran2059
data.value: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

data.name: Quran2060
data.value: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

data.name: Quran2061
data.value: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

data.name: Quran2062
data.value: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

data.name: Quran2063
data.value: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

data.name: Quran2064
data.value: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.

data.name: Quran2065
data.value: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.

data.name: Quran2066
data.value: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.

data.name: Quran2067
data.value: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.

data.name: Quran2068
data.value: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

data.name: Quran2069
data.value: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.

data.name: Quran2070
data.value: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.

data.name: Quran2071
data.value: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."

data.name: Quran2072
data.value: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

data.name: Quran2073
data.value: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

data.name: Quran2074
data.value: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.

data.name: Quran2075
data.value: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.

data.name: Quran2076
data.value: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

data.name: Quran2077
data.value: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

data.name: Quran2078
data.value: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"

data.name: Quran2079
data.value: Say, "Be you stones or iron

data.name: Quran2080
data.value: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -

data.name: Quran2081
data.value: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."

data.name: Quran2082
data.value: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

data.name: Quran2083
data.value: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.

data.name: Quran2084
data.value: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

data.name: Quran2085
data.value: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

data.name: Quran2086
data.value: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

data.name: Quran2087
data.value: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

data.name: Quran2088
data.value: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.

data.name: Quran2089
data.value: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

data.name: Quran2090
data.value: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

data.name: Quran2091
data.value: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."

data.name: Quran2092
data.value: [Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.

data.name: Quran2093
data.value: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

data.name: Quran2094
data.value: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

data.name: Quran2095
data.value: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

data.name: Quran2096
data.value: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

data.name: Quran2097
data.value: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

data.name: Quran2098
data.value: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

data.name: Quran2099
data.value: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

data.name: Quran2100
data.value: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

data.name: Quran2101
data.value: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

data.name: Quran2102
