data.value: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

data.name: Quran2103
data.value: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

data.name: Quran2104
data.value: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

data.name: Quran2105
data.value: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.

data.name: Quran2106
data.value: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.

data.name: Quran2107
data.value: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

data.name: Quran2108
data.value: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

data.name: Quran2109
data.value: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."

data.name: Quran2110
data.value: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."

data.name: Quran2111
data.value: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

data.name: Quran2112
data.value: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.

data.name: Quran2113
data.value: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."

data.name: Quran2114
data.value: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."

data.name: Quran2115
data.value: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

data.name: Quran2116
data.value: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

data.name: Quran2117
data.value: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."

data.name: Quran2118
data.value: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.

data.name: Quran2119
data.value: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.

data.name: Quran2120
data.value: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]

data.name: Quran2121
data.value: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]

data.name: Quran2122
data.value: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"

data.name: Quran2123
data.value: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"

data.name: Quran2124
data.value: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."

data.name: Quran2125
data.value: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."

data.name: Quran2126
data.value: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.

data.name: Quran2127
data.value: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

data.name: Quran2128
data.value: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.

data.name: Quran2129
data.value: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.

data.name: Quran2130
data.value: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."

data.name: Quran2131
data.value: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."

data.name: Quran2132
data.value: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

data.name: Quran2133
data.value: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

data.name: Quran2134
data.value: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

data.name: Quran2135
data.value: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.

data.name: Quran2136
data.value: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,

data.name: Quran2137
data.value: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."

data.name: Quran2138
data.value: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.

data.name: Quran2139
data.value: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.

data.name: Quran2140
data.value: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."

data.name: Quran2141
data.value: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.

data.name: Quran2142
data.value: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward

data.name: Quran2143
data.value: In which they will remain forever

data.name: Quran2144
data.value: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."

data.name: Quran2145
data.value: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.

data.name: Quran2146
data.value: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

data.name: Quran2147
data.value: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

data.name: Quran2148
data.value: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

data.name: Quran2149
data.value: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?

data.name: Quran2150
data.value: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."

data.name: Quran2151
data.value: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.

data.name: Quran2152
data.value: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

data.name: Quran2153
data.value: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

data.name: Quran2154
data.value: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.

data.name: Quran2155
data.value: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"

data.name: Quran2156
data.value: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."

data.name: Quran2157
data.value: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

data.name: Quran2158
data.value: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

data.name: Quran2159
data.value: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

data.name: Quran2160
data.value: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."

data.name: Quran2161
data.value: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."

data.name: Quran2162
data.value: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."

data.name: Quran2163
data.value: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"

data.name: Quran2164
data.value: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."

data.name: Quran2165
data.value: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.

data.name: Quran2166
data.value: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."

data.name: Quran2167
data.value: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

data.name: Quran2168
data.value: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

data.name: Quran2169
data.value: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

data.name: Quran2170
data.value: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

data.name: Quran2171
data.value: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

data.name: Quran2172
data.value: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

data.name: Quran2173
data.value: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

data.name: Quran2174
data.value: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."

data.name: Quran2175
data.value: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.

data.name: Quran2176
data.value: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."

data.name: Quran2177
data.value: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?

data.name: Quran2178
data.value: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

data.name: Quran2179
data.value: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

data.name: Quran2180
data.value: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

data.name: Quran2181
data.value: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."

data.name: Quran2182
data.value: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."

data.name: Quran2183
data.value: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.

data.name: Quran2184
data.value: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

data.name: Quran2185
data.value: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

data.name: Quran2186
data.value: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.

data.name: Quran2187
data.value: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.

data.name: Quran2188
data.value: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."

data.name: Quran2189
data.value: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.

data.name: Quran2190
data.value: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

data.name: Quran2191
data.value: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

data.name: Quran2192
data.value: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

data.name: Quran2193
data.value: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

data.name: Quran2194
data.value: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

data.name: Quran2195
data.value: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

data.name: Quran2196
data.value: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

data.name: Quran2197
data.value: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

data.name: Quran2198
data.value: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

data.name: Quran2199
data.value: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

data.name: Quran2200
data.value: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."

data.name: Quran2201
data.value: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

data.name: Quran2202
data.value: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

data.name: Quran2203
data.value: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".

data.name: Quran2204
data.value: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

data.name: Quran2205
data.value: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

data.name: Quran2206
data.value: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

data.name: Quran2207
data.value: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

data.name: Quran2208
data.value: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

data.name: Quran2209
data.value: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

data.name: Quran2210
data.value: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."

data.name: Quran2211
data.value: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

data.name: Quran2212
data.value: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

data.name: Quran2213
data.value: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."

data.name: Quran2214
data.value: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

data.name: Quran2215
data.value: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

data.name: Quran2216
data.value: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."

data.name: Quran2217
data.value: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."

data.name: Quran2218
data.value: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.

data.name: Quran2219
data.value: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

data.name: Quran2220
data.value: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

data.name: Quran2221
data.value: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

data.name: Quran2222
data.value: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

data.name: Quran2223
data.value: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."

data.name: Quran2224
data.value: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.

data.name: Quran2225
data.value: So he followed a way

data.name: Quran2226
data.value: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

data.name: Quran2227
data.value: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.

data.name: Quran2228
data.value: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."

data.name: Quran2229
data.value: Then he followed a way

data.name: Quran2230
data.value: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

data.name: Quran2231
data.value: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

data.name: Quran2232
data.value: Then he followed a way

data.name: Quran2233
data.value: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

data.name: Quran2234
data.value: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

data.name: Quran2235
data.value: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.

data.name: Quran2236
data.value: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

data.name: Quran2237
data.value: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

data.name: Quran2238
data.value: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."

data.name: Quran2239
data.value: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

data.name: Quran2240
data.value: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -

data.name: Quran2241
data.value: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

data.name: Quran2242
data.value: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

data.name: Quran2243
data.value: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

data.name: Quran2244
data.value: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."

data.name: Quran2245
data.value: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.

data.name: Quran2246
data.value: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

data.name: Quran2247
data.value: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

data.name: Quran2248
data.value: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

data.name: Quran2249
data.value: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."

data.name: Quran2250
data.value: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

data.name: Quran2251
data.value: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.

data.name: Quran2252
data.value: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

data.name: Quran2253
data.value: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.

data.name: Quran2254
data.value: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.

data.name: Quran2255
data.value: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

data.name: Quran2256
data.value: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

data.name: Quran2257
data.value: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."

data.name: Quran2258
data.value: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

data.name: Quran2259
data.value: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "

data.name: Quran2260
data.value: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."

data.name: Quran2261
data.value: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.

data.name: Quran2262
data.value: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy

data.name: Quran2263
data.value: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah

data.name: Quran2264
data.value: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

data.name: Quran2265
data.value: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

data.name: Quran2266
data.value: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

data.name: Quran2267
data.value: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

data.name: Quran2268
data.value: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."

data.name: Quran2269
data.value: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."

data.name: Quran2270
data.value: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

data.name: Quran2271
data.value: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "

data.name: Quran2272
data.value: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

data.name: Quran2273
data.value: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

data.name: Quran2274
data.value: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

data.name: Quran2275
data.value: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

data.name: Quran2276
data.value: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "

data.name: Quran2277
data.value: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

data.name: Quran2278
data.value: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

data.name: Quran2279
data.value: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

data.name: Quran2280
data.value: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

data.name: Quran2281
data.value: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive

data.name: Quran2282
data.value: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

data.name: Quran2283
data.value: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."

data.name: Quran2284
data.value: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

data.name: Quran2285
data.value: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

data.name: Quran2286
data.value: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

data.name: Quran2287
data.value: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

data.name: Quran2288
data.value: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

data.name: Quran2289
data.value: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.

data.name: Quran2290
data.value: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

data.name: Quran2291
data.value: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

data.name: Quran2292
data.value: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

data.name: Quran2293
data.value: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

data.name: Quran2294
data.value: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

data.name: Quran2295
data.value: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

data.name: Quran2296
data.value: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

data.name: Quran2297
data.value: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

data.name: Quran2298
data.value: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."

data.name: Quran2299
data.value: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

data.name: Quran2300
data.value: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.

data.name: Quran2301
data.value: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

data.name: Quran2302
data.value: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

data.name: Quran2303
data.value: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

data.name: Quran2304
data.value: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

data.name: Quran2305
data.value: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.

data.name: Quran2306
data.value: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

data.name: Quran2307
data.value: And We raised him to a high station.

data.name: Quran2308
data.value: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

data.name: Quran2309
data.value: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

data.name: Quran2310
data.value: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

data.name: Quran2311
data.value: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.

data.name: Quran2312
data.value: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

data.name: Quran2313
data.value: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.

data.name: Quran2314
data.value: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -

data.name: Quran2315
data.value: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

data.name: Quran2316
data.value: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

data.name: Quran2317
data.value: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

data.name: Quran2318
data.value: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

data.name: Quran2319
data.value: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

data.name: Quran2320
data.value: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

data.name: Quran2321
data.value: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

data.name: Quran2322
data.value: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

data.name: Quran2323
data.value: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

data.name: Quran2324
data.value: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

data.name: Quran2325
data.value: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

data.name: Quran2326
data.value: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

data.name: Quran2327
data.value: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"

data.name: Quran2328
data.value: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

data.name: Quran2329
data.value: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.

data.name: Quran2330
data.value: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

data.name: Quran2331
data.value: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

data.name: Quran2332
data.value: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

data.name: Quran2333
data.value: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?

data.name: Quran2334
data.value: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.

data.name: Quran2335
data.value: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

data.name: Quran2336
data.value: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

data.name: Quran2337
data.value: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

data.name: Quran2338
data.value: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

data.name: Quran2339
data.value: You have done an atrocious thing.

data.name: Quran2340
data.value: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

data.name: Quran2341
data.value: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

data.name: Quran2342
data.value: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

data.name: Quran2343
data.value: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

data.name: Quran2344
data.value: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

data.name: Quran2345
data.value: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

data.name: Quran2346
data.value: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

data.name: Quran2347
data.value: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

data.name: Quran2348
data.value: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

data.name: Quran2349
data.value: Ta, Ha.

data.name: Quran2350
data.value: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

data.name: Quran2351
data.value: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -

data.name: Quran2352
data.value: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

data.name: Quran2353
data.value: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

data.name: Quran2354
data.value: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

data.name: Quran2355
data.value: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

data.name: Quran2356
data.value: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

data.name: Quran2357
data.value: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

data.name: Quran2358
data.value: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."

data.name: Quran2359
data.value: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,

data.name: Quran2360
data.value: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

data.name: Quran2361
data.value: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].

data.name: Quran2362
data.value: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

data.name: Quran2363
data.value: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.

data.name: Quran2364
data.value: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.

data.name: Quran2365
data.value: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

data.name: Quran2366
data.value: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."

data.name: Quran2367
data.value: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."

data.name: Quran2368
data.value: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.

data.name: Quran2369
data.value: [Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.

data.name: Quran2370
data.value: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,

data.name: Quran2371
data.value: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

data.name: Quran2372
data.value: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."

data.name: Quran2373
data.value: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]

data.name: Quran2374
data.value: And ease for me my task

data.name: Quran2375
data.value: And untie the knot from my tongue

data.name: Quran2376
data.value: That they may understand my speech.

data.name: Quran2377
data.value: And appoint for me a minister from my family -

data.name: Quran2378
data.value: Aaron, my brother.

data.name: Quran2379
data.value: Increase through him my strength

data.name: Quran2380
data.value: And let him share my task

data.name: Quran2381
data.value: That we may exalt You much

data.name: Quran2382
data.value: And remember You much.

data.name: Quran2383
data.value: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."

data.name: Quran2384
data.value: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.

data.name: Quran2385
data.value: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,

data.name: Quran2386
data.value: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

data.name: Quran2387
data.value: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.

data.name: Quran2388
data.value: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.

data.name: Quran2389
data.value: And I produced you for Myself.

data.name: Quran2390
data.value: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.

data.name: Quran2391
data.value: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

data.name: Quran2392
data.value: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."

data.name: Quran2393
data.value: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."

data.name: Quran2394
data.value: [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.

data.name: Quran2395
data.value: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

data.name: Quran2396
data.value: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "

data.name: Quran2397
data.value: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

data.name: Quran2398
data.value: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."

data.name: Quran2399
data.value: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"

data.name: Quran2400
data.value: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

data.name: Quran2401
data.value: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.

data.name: Quran2402
data.value: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.

data.name: Quran2403
data.value: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.

data.name: Quran2404
data.value: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

data.name: Quran2405
data.value: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

data.name: Quran2406
data.value: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."

data.name: Quran2407
data.value: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."

data.name: Quran2408
data.value: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

data.name: Quran2409
data.value: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

data.name: Quran2410
data.value: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.

data.name: Quran2411
data.value: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.

data.name: Quran2412
data.value: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."

data.name: Quran2413
data.value: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."

data.name: Quran2414
data.value: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].

data.name: Quran2415
data.value: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

data.name: Quran2416
data.value: Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.

data.name: Quran2417
data.value: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."

data.name: Quran2418
data.value: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

data.name: Quran2419
data.value: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

data.name: Quran2420
data.value: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.

data.name: Quran2421
data.value: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."

data.name: Quran2422
data.value: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.

data.name: Quran2423
data.value: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

data.name: Quran2424
data.value: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

data.name: Quran2425
data.value: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

data.name: Quran2426
data.value: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

data.name: Quran2427
data.value: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

data.name: Quran2428
data.value: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

data.name: Quran2429
data.value: [Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen."

data.name: Quran2430
data.value: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

data.name: Quran2431
data.value: [Allah] said, "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"

data.name: Quran2432
data.value: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."

data.name: Quran2433
data.value: [Allah] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray."

data.name: Quran2434
data.value: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

data.name: Quran2435
data.value: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw."

data.name: Quran2436
data.value: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."

data.name: Quran2437
data.value: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

data.name: Quran2438
data.value: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."

data.name: Quran2439
data.value: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."

data.name: Quran2440
data.value: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

data.name: Quran2441
data.value: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"

data.name: Quran2442
data.value: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.' "

data.name: Quran2443
data.value: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"

data.name: Quran2444
data.value: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."

data.name: Quran2445
data.value: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.

data.name: Quran2446
data.value: Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."

data.name: Quran2447
data.value: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.

data.name: Quran2448
data.value: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,

data.name: Quran2449
data.value: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

data.name: Quran2450
data.value: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

data.name: Quran2451
data.value: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

data.name: Quran2452
data.value: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."

data.name: Quran2453
data.value: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

data.name: Quran2454
data.value: And He will leave the earth a level plain;

data.name: Quran2455
data.value: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."

data.name: Quran2456
data.value: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

data.name: Quran2457
data.value: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

data.name: Quran2458
data.value: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.

data.name: Quran2459
data.value: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

data.name: Quran2460
data.value: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

data.name: Quran2461
data.value: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

data.name: Quran2462
data.value: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

data.name: Quran2463
data.value: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

data.name: Quran2464
data.value: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.

data.name: Quran2465
data.value: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

data.name: Quran2466
data.value: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.

data.name: Quran2467
data.value: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."

data.name: Quran2468
data.value: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"

data.name: Quran2469
data.value: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

data.name: Quran2470
data.value: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

data.name: Quran2471
data.value: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].

data.name: Quran2472
data.value: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."

data.name: Quran2473
data.value: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"

data.name: Quran2474
data.value: [Allah] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."

data.name: Quran2475
data.value: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

data.name: Quran2476
data.value: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

data.name: Quran2477
data.value: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

data.name: Quran2478
data.value: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.

data.name: Quran2479
data.value: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

data.name: Quran2480
data.value: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

data.name: Quran2481
data.value: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?

data.name: Quran2482
data.value: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

data.name: Quran2483
data.value: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."

data.name: Quran2484
data.value: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.

data.name: Quran2485
data.value: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

data.name: Quran2486
data.value: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"

data.name: Quran2487
data.value: The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

data.name: Quran2488
data.value: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

data.name: Quran2489
data.value: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?

data.name: Quran2490
data.value: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

data.name: Quran2491
data.value: And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].

data.name: Quran2492
data.value: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.

data.name: Quran2493
data.value: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?

data.name: Quran2494
data.value: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.

data.name: Quran2495
data.value: And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.

data.name: Quran2496
data.value: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."

data.name: Quran2497
data.value: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2498
data.value: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].

data.name: Quran2499
data.value: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.

data.name: Quran2500
data.value: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.

data.name: Quran2501
data.value: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

data.name: Quran2502
data.value: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.

data.name: Quran2503
data.value: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.

data.name: Quran2504
data.value: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?

data.name: Quran2505
data.value: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

data.name: Quran2506
data.value: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

data.name: Quran2507
data.value: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

data.name: Quran2508
data.value: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."

data.name: Quran2509
data.value: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.

data.name: Quran2510
data.value: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.

data.name: Quran2511
data.value: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

data.name: Quran2512
data.value: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

data.name: Quran2513
data.value: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?

data.name: Quran2514
data.value: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.

data.name: Quran2515
data.value: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

data.name: Quran2516
data.value: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

data.name: Quran2517
data.value: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?

data.name: Quran2518
data.value: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

data.name: Quran2519
data.value: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.

data.name: Quran2520
data.value: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.

data.name: Quran2521
data.value: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

data.name: Quran2522
data.value: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...

data.name: Quran2523
data.value: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

data.name: Quran2524
data.value: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

data.name: Quran2525
data.value: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.

data.name: Quran2526
data.value: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

data.name: Quran2527
data.value: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?

data.name: Quran2528
data.value: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

data.name: Quran2529
data.value: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2530
data.value: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

data.name: Quran2531
data.value: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

data.name: Quran2532
data.value: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

data.name: Quran2533
data.value: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?

data.name: Quran2534
data.value: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

data.name: Quran2535
data.value: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

data.name: Quran2536
data.value: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

data.name: Quran2537
data.value: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

data.name: Quran2538
data.value: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

data.name: Quran2539
data.value: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

data.name: Quran2540
data.value: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

data.name: Quran2541
data.value: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

data.name: Quran2542
data.value: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2543
data.value: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

data.name: Quran2544
data.value: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

data.name: Quran2545
data.value: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

data.name: Quran2546
data.value: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

data.name: Quran2547
data.value: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2548
data.value: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

data.name: Quran2549
data.value: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

data.name: Quran2550
data.value: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"

data.name: Quran2551
data.value: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."

data.name: Quran2552
data.value: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

data.name: Quran2553
data.value: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.

data.name: Quran2554
data.value: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.

data.name: Quran2555
data.value: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.

data.name: Quran2556
data.value: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.

data.name: Quran2557
data.value: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

data.name: Quran2558
data.value: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

data.name: Quran2559
data.value: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.

data.name: Quran2560
data.value: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.

data.name: Quran2561
data.value: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

data.name: Quran2562
data.value: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

data.name: Quran2563
data.value: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?

data.name: Quran2564
data.value: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

data.name: Quran2565
data.value: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.

data.name: Quran2566
data.value: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."

data.name: Quran2567
data.value: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].

data.name: Quran2568
data.value: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

data.name: Quran2569
data.value: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

data.name: Quran2570
data.value: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2571
data.value: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

data.name: Quran2572
data.value: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."

data.name: Quran2573
data.value: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

data.name: Quran2574
data.value: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

data.name: Quran2575
data.value: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

data.name: Quran2576
data.value: And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.

data.name: Quran2577
data.value: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.

data.name: Quran2578
data.value: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return

data.name: Quran2579
data.value: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

data.name: Quran2580
data.value: And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."

data.name: Quran2581
data.value: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.

data.name: Quran2582
data.value: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.

data.name: Quran2583
data.value: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.

data.name: Quran2584
data.value: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.

data.name: Quran2585
data.value: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.

data.name: Quran2586
data.value: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -

data.name: Quran2587
data.value: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.

data.name: Quran2588
data.value: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

data.name: Quran2589
data.value: Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.

data.name: Quran2590
data.value: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

data.name: Quran2591
data.value: Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"

data.name: Quran2592
data.value: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.

data.name: Quran2593
data.value: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.

data.name: Quran2594
data.value: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."

data.name: Quran2595
data.value: [The Prophet] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."

data.name: Quran2596
data.value: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

data.name: Quran2597
